text: Olei Hagardom (, meaning "those hanged in the gallows") is the name of twelve Zionist activists who were sentenced to death between 1938 and 1947 in the British Mandate of Palestine. They were members of the militant groups Irgun and Lehi, who fought against Arabs and the British for an independent State of Israel. The Olei Hagardom included nine members of Irgun and three members of Lehi, who were executed by hanging. A national burial site of the Olei Hagardom is located in the national military and police cemetery in Mount Herzl in Jerusalem. A museum for the Olei HaGardom is located in Jerusalem and the old city of Acre. == Other websites == * Olei Hagardom article in Jabotinsky Institute website Category:Burials at Mount Herzl Category:History of Palestine Category:Israeli nationalists Category:Israeli criminals Category:Jewish terrorists Category:People executed by hanging Category:Zionists
title: Olei Hagardom
